report.title: "Women in Engineering" special session @ IEEE conference MOS AK India 2019

description.text: <p><strong>Women in Engineering (WiE) Special track on&nbsp; "Challenges and opportunities for women in Engineering", at IEEE MOS AK India Conference, 2019 at IIT Hyderabad on 26th February.&nbsp;</strong>Women in Engineering(WiE) track at&nbsp;<span class="il">MOS</span>&nbsp;<span class="il">AK</span>&nbsp;India 2019 with three keynote talks and one panel discussion for challenges and opportunities for women engineers in the afternoon session on 26 February 2019 from 3.00PM to 6.00PM. The keynote speakers&nbsp; are Dr. Weronika from AGH, Poland Dr. Usha Gogeneni from Maxim Semicondocturs and Mrs. Uma Devi,Deputy Director, SDRISA, NRSC/ISRO .<strong>&nbsp;</strong></p>

report.cosponsor_name: IEEE Circuits and Systems/Electron Devices of Hyderabad Section

topic.title: Radiation Effects on Circuits for Space and High-Energy Physics Applications – A case study
Challenges and opportunities for Women in Engineering

description.text: <p>IEEE Women in Engineering Affinity Group in association with Muffakham Jah College of Engineering &amp; Technology celebrated International Women&rsquo;s Day &ldquo;Balance for Better&rdquo; on 1.3.2019 at Ghulam Ahmed Auditorium. Ms Sikha Goel, IPS, Additional Commissioner of Police, SHE Teams, Ms. Rani Reddy, Director Sakshi Media were invited to grace the occasion. More than 300 participants were benefitted from the session. Ms Sikha awakened the audience about Hawk Eye App and a network of 2,70,000 camera across Hyderabad which have&nbsp; helped the city become a safer place. She added that&rdquo; Crime rate in Hyderabad has fallen by 40% particularly in murder cases while crimes against women have dipped by 25%. Officials in casual dress moving through the city are recorded in nearly 100 different cameras, assuring the city is growing safer by the day.</p>

speaker.organization: IPS, Additional Commissioner of Police, SHE Teams

topic.title: Short films on empowering women for balanced society

description.text: <p>WIE Affinity group &amp; IEEE NMREC Student Branch has conducted a One-day &rdquo;<strong>Symposium on Women Empowerment</strong> &ldquo; on March 2<sup>nd</sup> 2019.</p>

report.title: Women's Day at Geethanjali college of Engineering and Technology

description.text: <p>As has been scheduled earlier we organized Poster Presentations/Painting &amp; Poems Competition&nbsp;&nbsp; On Women&rsquo;s day at Block 1. Good number of students were presented innovative and informative posters exactly related to the topic assigned by us. We invited faculty members from different departments as judges, all the judges well appreciated the participants with very good remarks, very good number of audience were visited the event and acknowledged the students. Details of the participants, winners,&nbsp; photo gallery are mentioned below:</p>

report.cosponsor_name: Geethanjali College of Engineering and Technology

report.title: Technical Colloquium

description.text: <p>With the encouragement and funding provided by the college, in association with IEEE Hyderabad Section ,Technical Colloquium has been organized with great enthusiasm and determination of the student coordinators, student volunteers of IEEE CVRCE Student branch and faculty coordinators on March 13<sup>th</sup>, 2019. It&rsquo;s a event to discuss the technical advancement in a forum.</p> <p>The technical talk was successful enough to attract as many as 113 registrations from all the branches of engineering.&nbsp; The chief guests of the event are Mr.N.Venkatesh, Vice President of Advanced Technologies at Redpine Signals also Chair &ndash;IEEE Hyderabad Section, Mr.Bala Prasad Peddigari, Technology Head &ndash;Digital Initiatives, Tata Consultancy Services Limited also Secretary-IEEE Hyderabad Section,Dr.K.Lal Kishore,Dean Research &amp;Professor of ECE,CVR college of engineering.</p>

report.keywords: Mobile Technologies Digital Initiatives key technologies in the internet of things

topic.title: key Technologies in Internet of Things

report.title: Women Conclave-A meet of corporate and Academia Women

description.text: <p>Women in Engineering Affinity Group, IEEE Hyderabad Section in collaboration with Infosys is organizing one day event <strong>"Women Conclave - a meet of Corporate and Academia Women",</strong> under the aegis of International Women's Day Celebration to progress the women in technology. This event will give an opportunity to collaborate, share, learn and inspire through interactions with corporate women with academia women and experts across industry</p>

report.title: WALK THE TALK-VARDHAMAN 2019

description.text: <p>IEEE Women in Engineering Affinity Group has come up with first edition of their flagship event called &ldquo;WALK THE TALK&rdquo; in association with IEEE Vardhaman Student Branch under IEEE Hyderabad Section with the theme of "<strong>Go Confidently and Live the Life You Have Always Imagined</strong>&rdquo; on 26<sup>th</sup> and 27<sup>th</sup> July 2019. The event had diverse speakers from wide areas like entrepreneurship, advancing technology, safety &amp; security, social reforms, health care and many more. The student coordinators were Mr. M. Sai Prashanth and T. Thanmai. The Event was attended by 350+ students from various reputed institutes across Telangana.&nbsp;The chief guest for the event was Ms. Deepthi Ravula, CEO WE-HUB, Hyderabad.&nbsp; The aim of this event was to bring members from different student branches together to collaborate on new ideas and get awareness about the latest trends and innovations in their Leadership Skills, Women Safety and Security, Health and Career Development. Also to administer the IEEE Student and Research Engineer Program to mentor young girls in junior high schools.</p>

report.keywords: Leadership skills Women safety and security health and career development

topic.title: Effort taken to control satellites from ground system
